comments.body: i tried so many ways with my friends to join my custom server that i am hosting and there is no way for me to do so and everyone want a free always running server to join and have fun that you can play with friends.

If you are on java, I can help(mojang may not like my answer here), but many hack clients have a module called Anti-AFK which prevents you from being kicked by AFK plugins, could work on realms, If you want a vanilla option, just tape the spacebar, and it will have you jump up and down, preventing AFK kick.
Minecraft friend problem
I was looking for a mod like this for civ 6. and this was what came up
As a fellow server developer, I support this, though it will likely never happen.

Have you tried the Bedrock Dedicated Server?
It is still in alpha, but version 1.14 works great.

I think due to the limitations of the game's design this would be really hard to implement. It could also be abused by hacked clients, for example sending the pause signal to the server and still being able to move around and stuff.
This is a great idea. Mojang/Microsoft please fix this
YES! Please - why isn't this already possible??

I think show coordinates should be a client-side option, not a server-side option. If it was crucial for their minigames, maybe servers could have the possibilty to disable coordinates for all. Make show coordinates a client-side option, not a server-side option.

Personally, I would love this, but I doubt Java will have this due to massive configs needed to actually host one- Maybe just for default yeah, but I doubt they will even do that. But I support the idea and would love to see it happen!
Pls a new server for me!!
To bedrock and java

In english:

My suggestion is that Minecraft Bedrock have an official server, which has the minigames of the old console edition, a server to play in local multiplayer and online multiplayer, this would allow having a better optimized server and being able to play locally on the server without the need for gold, similar to the minigames of minecraft console edition (legacy), the way to do it could be to add the server in the servers tab or create a new option in the initial menu called "minigames"
Please add realms for free, devs. It's so cool a concept but I don't wanna pay for it.
I respectfully disagree we prevented a major griefing because we could see people's private messages
I agree, the server owner is unfairly using this feature to find bases on a realm Im in.

As said in the post there is a gamerule to turn this logging off but that's completely in the operators control. From an owner / moderator standpoint it is valuable to be able to recognise what's going on & address it as it happens. However, what's not ok is theres no warning or indication to users that their whisper usage is not private. Many official servers do see the private messages you send, the difference? They warn you of that & say that the rules still apply (just in case theres still some uncertainty).
As a SMP owner, I agree, I don't want to see other Players' Whispers
I was just talking about how realms need this and then I went on this forum and I see it!
It will send a notification to your device and will be held for a certain period of time?
Just don't play on such servers, lol. Every server finds it's own way how to pay for hosting. Nobody forces you to play there or donate.
i dont know which server sells admin perms XD

Disclaimer: 
*For now, Realm Stories is only available for Realms subscribers and players in Preview and Beta for Minecraft: Bedrock Edition. We are planning a wider Minecraft: Bedrock Edition rollout soon, so Bedrock players, keep your eyes peeled! 

**If you've downloaded the newest version of Minecraft Preview/Beta but still see the old Realm Feed when you click the book, try closing the game and restarting it.
How about it being available in Java Edition and the Minecraft Launcher?

I would like to recommend the timeline time stamps that tell you what exact times the player logged on or off. I know as a realm manager this would help me deal with problems of stealing or even griefing. On that same, not a way to easily check players' inventory and E-Ceast would help with issues of steeling on Realms. I feel these additions would allow realm owners to mange realms effectively and would make player experience better over all.
Realms Stories should come to Java Edition. https://feedback.minecraft.net/hc/en-us/community/posts/23377609196685--Bedrock-Parity-Realms-Stories
Mine doesn't show realm stories and is fully updated, what should I do?
Mines fully updated and I can't see the realms stories do I have to have a realms subscription of my own despite having joined someone else's realm
it was annoying how the owner had to opt before me but thats my only problem
I want to diable this for my realm because it goves away base cords when it said the cords of newly found structure
When posting to the feed there should be an option for an XYZ coordinate stamp, it would save a lot of time and look nicer than typing it manually!
Change the realms loading screen back to nether portal.

The lag on my realm is terrible. The world I play on with my friends is about 2 years old now and I made a realm for us in march this year. It's really nice to be able to not be there while my friends play, but It just sucks that it's gotten so laggy. The latest Vibrant Visuals update has made it even worse as it's barely playable with only 3 people online. I want more from this paid service, and I really hope they can find a way to make it better.

I agree, I tried to download a free server off there website and it almost gave me a virus!

You should be able to add then join someone's world without a server or LAN.

And!... paying for Minecraft, then being forced to pay for a server hosting programs. I'd say that's kind of scummy on Mojang's behalf!

Its so you cant use the copy of the world to cheat to find rare items. If you download it you can do whatever you want with it and learn cords for things and then go back into the realm to get the items. For example using xray

Mojang/Microsoft please implement this. It'd be useful for when realm members are on consoles and the owner wants to close the realm but other members want to download a world to upload it to a new realm
It would almost work like the backups. Just a time list of when players join, and leave. This can be useful for attendance, finding out who stole/greifed, and other things.

YES, EXACTLY, this would help me so much in tracking down people and giving them appropriate punishments, every time someone griefs, I HAVE TO BAN THE WHOLE REALM, and BACK IT UP, and then reinvite rusted people, smh.

That is possible, by using a command. All you need to do is /gamerule sleepingPercent and add the amount. For example if there were 2 people in the realm, and you wanted only one person to have to sleep at a time you type in (make sure commands are on) /gamerule sleepingPercent 50 

It means that only 50% of the players have to be playing at one time to skip night. (if there are 2 people)
It only works on the java version realms however I really hope that they port this to bedrock realms too
Friends for manicraft beta
Been an issue for a while! What’s the point of a member or an operator? To send a whisper???!? At least let operators change the game difficulty, which doesn’t enable cheats on survival worlds!

Why is this not a thing? This is one of the most basic things in minecraft. I shouldn't lose the ability to earn achievements so my friends can change the difficulty. If this is not changed soon, i will probably be canceling my realms subscription. It makes it useless
pls minecraft i need to change to peaceful sometimes

This needs to be a thing. I've needed blaze rods for a week, but due to having a job and life, the realms owner hasn't had a chance to update the difficulty off of peaceful. I'm an operator, I should be able to update the difficulty without using cheats. Honestly, I've had an issue with this for long enough that I'm content with Minecraft at least explaining why operators can't change the difficulty on realms if they can't be arsed to fix it.
I concur with this idea.  It would be good to allow education edition of Minecraft to be able to connect to the Bedrock Server.  Right now when you attempt to connect you get this error message:
Let me play Build Battle
I want to do the same thing
You can use OneDrive or even an SD card on iPad to transfer your saves.
Sadly, you can't but, it would be great for Mojang to add this.

like server-ip= in Minecraft java

thanks
Yes, that would be very helpful!
hey man, you can do this already, all you need to do is exit the realm, go onto your worlds, click the 'edit' pencil and click on the 'download world' button, Hope this helps :)
